title.narrative: Toward a sustainable and better quality of life of small farmers in the dry corridor of Nicaragua

description.narrative: Nicaragua is devastated by disasters due to climate change. In the last decade cycles of severe droughts and floods have caused enormous impact in the region. Nicaragua rates as the fourth country most affected by extreme weather events (Global climate index, Germanwatch, 2015). Nicaragua´s dry corridor where this programme will be implemented is agriculturally challenged but is the only land that subsistence farmers can access with 800 mm of annual rain. Here the malnutrition rate is 20%-27%, above the national average of 16% and the concentration of the most vulnerable poor is greatest (rural 68% versus urban 29%). The four municipalities where the partners work are identified as very critical to suffering recurrent droughts (Nicaragua Territorial Study Institute - INITER 2011). The frequency of natural disaster occurrences is increasing due to climate change. The region will be hit increasingly harder over the next 50 years unless action to mitigate and adapt (ECLA, 2009) is taken. These vulnerable rural communities are trapped in a cycle of poverty and lack of access to resilient livelihoods (water, nutritious food, incomes). This three year project will contribute to 900 HH increasing their resilient livelihoods and to reducing climate change vulnerability for men and women in the poorest communities in the dry corridor of these three departments. Given their central location their experiences and best practices will become known to other communities and people our partner work with.
